channel.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
channel.description:
I don't know what made me do this but I decided to play all the old games again. Games I played when I was a kid.
When I was a kid my first computer was a Mac OS 7.5.3. I only ever got up to 8.1 before I got a PC I think. Anyways, I had some kickass games I got off usenet on that thing.
After Dark Games. Escape Velocity (and EV: Overide) SimAnt SimTower Terminal Velocity etc.
So I just dug deep in my memory to remember everything I used to emulate this Mac on my PC years ago.
So now I have Basilisk II running Mac OS 8.1 (I have a working 8.6 update floppy set, but my 8.5 install is corrupt) and I've installed the games onto it. Some kid in school saw my screen when I was just finished installing the OS and he was like "The fuck?!" He thought my laptop was super old school.
And on a similar note, I'm plugging in my PS2 and searching through 6 cases of games to find PsyOps, cause I just remembered how awesome that game was.
So post some nostalgia moments here.

item.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:1, topic:290516”]SimAnt
SimTower[/quote]
Loved those! Along with SimLife, Simcity 2000 and Simcopter a large amount of childhood was spent on those games.

Read full topic

item.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Doom, and Castle of the winds. I still remember saving my money and ordering the floppy of Castle of the Winds 2 for $19.99 by mail. (before internet or email)

Read full topic

I grew up pretty much with DOS, GB, NES and SNES, even though I was born a lot later than that.
Used to play: Commander keen <3

is that 4 and 5?
Anyway, commander keen was the most epic game i ever played!

item.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

I grew up pretty much with DOS, GB, NES and SNES, even though I was born a lot later than that.
Used to play: Commander keen <3, jill of the jungle, dangerous dave, sokoban (lol), hocus pocus, super mario bros 1 2 and 3, super mario world, lufia 2, pokemon, batman.

Read full topic

item.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Cowie`:

Abes oddysee

I NEED THAT GAME! I remember when he farted and I lold hard.

Personally I like playing the N64 Classics like Legend Of Zelda:Ocarina of Time, Goldeneye and Perfect Dark.

Read full topic

item.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I had much fun with The Incredible Machine, albeit I felt very lame for that.

Get this, I searched ALL my PS2 games (6 cases ~60 discs each, 4 stacks 8" tall, 3 of the tall 1’ disc containers) and it was the VERY BOTTOM ONE OF THE LAST STACK. WTF.

But I found a LOT of incredible PS2 games and a few PS1 games.

Dead Ball Zone. Kinda like soccer with basketball, except people die a lot.
Rock Em Sock Em Robots something. You could upgrade your parts.
Panzer Bandit. Awesome side scroller.
Wild 9: Torture Your Enemies. Really neat deaths.
Team Buddies. PS1 game I think, but it is SO fun. Four teams. Start with one guy each. You get building blocks and make other buddies or weapons to make a small army and kill the other teams. But very cute graphics.
Etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Overwhelming Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

Legend Of Zelda:Ocarina of Time, I just want to play this game sometimes, even when I have finished it 2-3 times.

The same with Banjo Kazooie.

Also Gex Deep Cover Gecko.

I have problem finding out what this game was called but it was for the NES, some caveman on a skateboard or something :S
EDIT: I found it. It’s called Adventure Island

I have basicly played games since I was 5 , so the N64 was my first “new” console, since my brother had the NES before I was born.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lawl wrote:

portal, guess its not really nostalgia cause its only a couple years old, but sometimes i just get really strong random urges to play

item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah! I played that one too, but I sucked at it.

I also played this game called Syndicate, which I have never been able to find again, and Master of Orion.
